My startup script for my Linux desktop environment

startup
Linux
Author

Sam Watkins

Published

February 24, 2023

Introduction

I am working on a startup.sh script, to open various apps and webpages when I log in to my Linux PC.

Testing and debugging this script is a bit annoying. My approach up until now has been to make fixes to the script, close everything, exit my desktop session, then log in again and see what happens. Another possibility is to copy-paste lines out of the script into the terminal.

Now I’m going to try developing the script as a Jupyter notebook with the Bash kernel. I will also write a script to generate the shell script from the notebook.

Workspaces and Apps

I use two monitors:

  1. Left monitor, doesn’t switch workspaces, for apps that I want always to hand.
  2. Right monitor, widescreen, does switch between workspaces, for work.

Apps on left monitor:

  1. Gnome Pomodoro - timer
  2. Trello - tasks planner
  3. ChatGPT - AI assistant
  4. Miniflux - blog reader
  5. Anki - learning with flashcards
  6. Swatch - my system monitor script

I am using these workspaces:

  1. Entertainment
    • playing music
    • watching movies
    • terminal with GNU screen
  2. Miscellaneous
    • sysadmin
    • random stuff
  3. AI Study
    • Jupyter notebook
    • Quarto blog
    • terminal with GNU screen

I can add extra workspaces as needed when I work on other projects.

The startup script

#!/bin/bash
# usage: source from ~/.xsessionrc
sleep 1
gnome-dark
connects &

Try to get out of the Activities Overview

xdotool key 'Super'; sleep 1 ; xdotool key 'Escape'

Common apps on the left monitor

chrome_profile Sam --new-window \
"https://trello.com/b/dnuAgKw1/ai" \
"https://trello.com/b/y16reUe3/misc" \
"https://chat.openai.com/chat" \
&
chrome_profile Sam --new-window \
"https://miniflux.ucm.dev/unread" \
"https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLqkzs79RU9yUrYAN083Jbiza9DMqQE1dq" \
&
gnome-pomodoro &
barrier &
anki &
swatch &
flameshot &
# miniflux &
# chatgpt &
discord --start-minimized &
slack --startup &
sleep 1
wmctrl -r Trello -e 0,960,0,960,1080
wmctrl -r pomodoro -e 0,0,0,400,400
wmctrl -r Barrier -e 0,400,0,400,400
wmctrl -r Anki -e 0,0,0,960,540
wmctrl -r Miniflux -e 0,0,540,960,540
xdotool search --name swatch windowmove 100 100

for app in Trello pomodoro Anki swatch Trello Miniflux; do
    wmctrl -r "$app" -b add,sticky
done
wmctrl -r pomodoro -b add,above

for app in barrier; do wmctrl -c $app; done
gnome-pomodoro --start

Apps on Workspace 1: Entertainment

wmctrl -s 0
xterm -e '. entertain' &

Apps on Workspace 2: Miscellaneous

# Open a window in workspace 1, we will later move it to workspace 2.
# This seems to be necessary to get anything onto workspace 2.
nautilus ~/plan.dev &
# move that window and switch to workspace 2
sleep 1
wmctrl -r plan.dev -e 0,1920,0,400,400
wmctrl -r plan.dev -t 1
wmctrl -s 1

Apps on Workspace 3: AI Study

wmctrl -s 2
zotero &
xterm -e '. ai' &
sleep 1
xdotool search --name zotero windowminimize %@

Exporting the script

# __END__
jupyter nbconvert --no-prompt --to script startup.ipynb --stdout \
--TemplateExporter.exclude_raw=True |
sed -n '/^# __END__/q; p' > startup.sh
chmod +x startup.sh
mv -v ./startup.sh ~/local/x/startup.sh
